metadata.Title: CVE-2022-37609 on Ubuntu 20.04 ESM (focal) - medium.
metadata.Description: Prototype pollution vulnerability in beautify-web js-beautify 1.13.7 via the name variable in options.js.

notes.Note: tyhicks> mozjs contains a copy of the SpiderMonkey JavaScript engine mdeslaur> starting with Ubuntu 22.04, the firefox package is just a script that installs the Firefox snap rodrigo-zaiden> firefox and thunderbird includes jsbeautify code in devtools/

criterions.comment: firefox: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'bundled deps handled by upstream in new versions').
mozjs52 package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
mozjs68 package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
node-js-beautify package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
thunderbird: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'bundled deps handled by upstream in new versions').
